article.headline: UMBC 69, Hartford 60
article.story: CATONSVILLE, Md. -- Jay Greene scored 17 points, Darryl Proctor added 14 points and 14 rebounds, and Maryland-Baltimore County beat Hartford 69-60 on Saturday night. Matt Spadafora had 15 points and six assists, while Chauncey Gilliam and Rich Flemming each scored 10 points for the Retrievers (8-8, 2-2 America East Conference). Greene hit a season-high five 3-pointers for UMBC, which won despite going 12-for-20 from the free-throw line. Morgan Sabia led Hartford (6-12, 2-2) with 18 points. Michael Turner had 12 points and 11 rebounds for the Hawks, who have dropped three of four games. Consecutive 3-pointers by Turner and Andres Torres pulled Hartford within 41-39 with 15:15 remaining. Spadafora responded with a jumper from the foul line, igniting an 18-6 UMBC run. Flemming had eight points during the burst, capping it with a steal and a layup for a 59-45 lead.

statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
